fromChainId.merge_dataflows: function receive(uint256 fromChainId, address to, uint256 nonce, uint256 volume, Signature[] memory signatures) virtual external payable {require(received[fromChainId][to][nonce] == 0, 'withdrawn already');uint N = signatures.length;require(N >= Factory(factory).getConfig(_minSignatures_), 'too few signatures');for(uint i=0; i<N; i++) {for(uint j=0; j<i; j++)require(signatures[i].signatory != signatures[j].signatory, 'repetitive signatory');bytes32 structHash = keccak256(abi.encode(RECEIVE_TYPEHASH, fromChainId, to, nonce, volume, signatures[i].signatory));bytes32 digest = keccak256(abi.encodePacked("\x19\x01", _DOMAIN_SEPARATOR, structHash));address signatory = ecrecover(digest, signatures[i].v, signatures[i].r, signatures[i].s);require(signatory != address(0), "invalid signature");require(signatory == signatures[i].signatory, "unauthorized");_decreaseAuthQuota(signatures[i].signatory, volume);emit Authorize(fromChainId, to, nonce, volume, signatory);}received[fromChainId][to][nonce] = volume;_receive(to, volume);emit Receive(fromChainId, to, nonce, volume);}function _decreaseAuthQuota(address signatory, uint decrement) virtual internal updateAutoQuota(signatory) returns (uint quota) {quota = _authQuotas[signatory].sub(decrement);_authQuotas[signatory] = quota;emit DecreaseAuthQuota(signatory, decrement, quota);}function _receive(address to, uint256 volume) virtual internal;function _chargeFee() virtual internal {require(msg.value >= Math.min(Factory(factory).getConfig(_fee_), 0.1 ether), 'fee is too low');address payable feeTo = address(Factory(factory).getConfig(_feeTo_));if(feeTo == address(0))feeTo = address(uint160(factory));feeTo.transfer(msg.value);emit ChargeFee(_msgSender(), feeTo, msg.value);}

to.merge_dataflows: function receive(uint256 fromChainId, address to, uint256 nonce, uint256 volume, Signature[] memory signatures) virtual external payable {require(received[fromChainId][to][nonce] == 0, 'withdrawn already');uint N = signatures.length;require(N >= Factory(factory).getConfig(_minSignatures_), 'too few signatures');for(uint i=0; i<N; i++) {for(uint j=0; j<i; j++) require(signatures[i].signatory != signatures[j].signatory, 'repetitive signatory');}bytes32 structHash = keccak256(abi.encode(RECEIVE_TYPEHASH, fromChainId, to, nonce, volume, signatures[i].signatory));bytes32 digest = keccak256(abi.encodePacked("\x19\x01", _DOMAIN_SEPARATOR, structHash));address signatory = ecrecover(digest, signatures[i].v, signatures[i].r, signatures[i].s);require(signatory != address(0), "invalid signature");require(signatory == signatures[i].signatory, "unauthorized");_decreaseAuthQuota(signatures[i].signatory, volume);emit Authorize(fromChainId, to, nonce, volume, signatory);}received[fromChainId][to][nonce] = volume;_receive(to, volume);emit Receive(fromChainId, to, nonce, volume);}function _decreaseAuthQuota(address signatory, uint decrement) virtual internal updateAutoQuota(signatory) returns (uint quota) {quota = _authQuotas[signatory].sub(decrement);_authQuotas[signatory] = quota;emit DecreaseAuthQuota(signatory, decrement, quota);}function _chargeFee() virtual internal {require(msg.value >= Math.min(Factory(factory).getConfig(_fee_), 0.1 ether), 'fee is too low');address payable feeTo = address(Factory(factory).getConfig(_feeTo_));if(feeTo == address(0)) feeTo = address(uint160(factory));feeTo.transfer(msg.value);emit ChargeFee(_msgSender(), feeTo, msg.value);}function _receive(address to, uint256 volume) virtual internal;

nonce.merge_dataflows: function receive(uint256 fromChainId, address to, uint256 nonce, uint256 volume, Signature[] memory signatures) virtual external payable {        require(received[fromChainId][to][nonce] == 0, 'withdrawn already');        uint N = signatures.length;        require(N >= Factory(factory).getConfig(_minSignatures_), 'too few signatures');        for(uint i=0; i<N; i++) {            for(uint j=0; j<i;                require(signatures[i].signatory != signatures[j].signatory, 'repetitive signatory');            bytes32 structHash = keccak256(abi.encode(RECEIVE_TYPEHASH, fromChainId, to, nonce, volume, signatures[i].signatory));            bytes32 digest = keccak256(abi.encodePacked("\x19\x01", _DOMAIN_SEPARATOR, structHash));            address signatory = ecrecover(digest, signatures[i].v, signatures[i].r, signatures[i].s);            require(signatory != address(0), "invalid signature");            require(signatory == signatures[i].signatory, "unauthorized");            _decreaseAuthQuota(signatures[i].signatory, volume);            emit Authorize(fromChainId, to, nonce, volume, signatory);        }        received[fromChainId][to][nonce] = volume;        _receive(to, volume);        emit Receive(fromChainId, to, nonce, volume);    }function _decreaseAuthQuota(address signatory, uint decrement) virtual internal updateAutoQuota(signatory) returns (uint quota) {        quota = _authQuotas[signatory].sub(decrement);        _authQuotas[signatory] = quota;        emit DecreaseAuthQuota(signatory, decrement, quota);    }function _chargeFee() virtual internal {        require(msg.value >= Math.min(Factory(factory).getConfig(_fee_), 0.1 ether), 'fee is too low');        emit ChargeFee(_msgSender(), feeTo, msg.value);}function _transfer(address sender, address recipient, uint256 amount) internal virtual {        require(sender != address(0), "ERC20: transfer from the zero address");        emit Transfer(sender, recipient, amount);}function _mint(address account, uint256 amount) internal virtual {        require(account != address(0), "ERC20: mint to the zero address");        emit Transfer(address(0), account, amount);}

volume.merge_dataflows: function receive(uint256 fromChainId, address to, uint256 nonce, uint256 volume, Signature[] memory signatures) virtual external payable {        _chargeFee();        require(received[fromChainId][to][nonce] == 0, 'withdrawn already');        uint N = signatures.length;        require(N >= Factory(factory).getConfig(_minSignatures_), 'too few signatures');        for(uint i=0; i<N; i++) {            for(uint j=0; j<i; j++)                require(signatures[i].signatory != signatures[j].signatory, 'repetitive signatory');            bytes32 structHash = keccak256(abi.encode(RECEIVE_TYPEHASH, fromChainId, to, nonce, volume, signatures[i].signatory));            bytes32 digest = keccak256(abi.encodePacked("\x19\x01", _DOMAIN_SEPARATOR, structHash));            address signatory = ecrecover(digest, signatures[i].v, signatures[i].r, signatures[i].s);            require(signatory != address(0), "invalid signature");            require(signatory == signatures[i].signatory, "unauthorized");            _decreaseAuthQuota(signatures[i].signatory, volume);            emit Authorize(fromChainId, to, nonce, volume, signatory);        }        received[fromChainId][to][nonce] = volume;        _receive(to, volume);        emit Receive(fromChainId, to, nonce, volume);    }function _decreaseAuthQuota(address signatory, uint decrement) virtual internal updateAutoQuota(signatory) returns (uint quota) {        quota = _authQuotas[signatory].sub(decrement);        _authQuotas[signatory] = quota;        emit DecreaseAuthQuota(signatory, decrement, quota);    }function _receive(address to, uint256 volume) virtual internal;function _chargeFee() virtual internal {        require(msg.value >= Math.min(Factory(factory).getConfig(_fee_), 0.1 ether), 'fee is too low');        address payable feeTo = address(Factory(factory).getConfig(_feeTo_));        if(feeTo == address(0))            feeTo = address(uint160(factory));        feeTo.transfer(msg.value);        emit ChargeFee(_msgSender(), feeTo, msg.value);    }function min(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {        return a < b ? a : b;    }function _transfer(address sender, address recipient, uint256 amount) internal virtual {        require(sender != address(0), "ERC20: transfer from the zero address");        require(recipient != address(0), "ERC20: transfer to the zero address");        _beforeTokenTransfer(sender, recipient, amount);        _balances[sender] = _balances[sender].sub(amount, "ERC20: transfer amount exceeds balance");        _balances[recipient] = _balances[recipient].add(amount);        emit Transfer(sender, recipient, amount);    }function _mint(address account, uint256 amount) internal virtual {        require(account != address(0), "ERC20: mint to the zero address");        _beforeTokenTransfer(address(0), account, amount);        _totalSupply = _totalSupply.add(amount);        _balances[account] = _balances[account].add(amount);        emit Transfer(address(0), account, amount);    }function _beforeTokenTransfer(address from, address to, uint256 amount) internal virtual { }

verify_filtered.reason: The validation code correctly checks if the nonce has already been used (i.e., if received[fromChainId][to][nonce] equals 0) to prevent a replay attack. results.poc: An attacker can call the `receive` function multiple times with the same `fromChainId`, `to`, and `nonce` parameters, provided the initial call to update the `received` mapping has already been executed with a non-zero value. If the attacker can manipulate the state to create a scenario where the `require(received[fromChainId][to][nonce] == 0)` validation check passes (for instance, by avoiding the initial call or by having a race condition), they can bypass this validation.
results.reason: The validation relies on `received[fromChainId][to][nonce]` being zero to proceed, but there are potential race conditions and logic issues that could allow this check to pass incorrectly. An attacker could exploit timing or state manipulation to invoke the function multiple times with the same parameters before the mapping updates, thereby bypassing the intended safety check.

results.poc: An attacker could exploit timing-based scenarios where the `nonce` could be reused before the state updates propagate through the network. If they can resend the `nonce` while the previous transaction is still pending and the mapping hasn't been updated in time due to network latency or block confirmation delays, they could bypass the validation and create conflicting state changes.
results.reason: The validation of the 'nonce' relies on the assumption that it will not be reused before the state updates are completed. However, in a network with potential latency and pending transactions, an attacker might exploit timing-based scenarios to reuse a nonce, thus bypassing the validation check. This issue highlights a vulnerability in the logic that needs to be addressed to enhance security.

original.reason: The _transfer function updates the balance of both the sender and the recipient. It ensures that the recipient's balance is increased by the amount transferred from the sender's balance, thus validating that the recipientAddress's balance change equals the amount.
The code does not explicitly perform a check to validate the balance change after the transfer operation.
While the transfer of volume is implemented, the contract lacks a mechanism to verify the balance changes before and after the operation for the recipient address.

results.reason: The validation for the signatory checks if it is non-zero and matches the provided signature, but a forged signature could still pass these checks as long as it resolves to a valid non-zero address. This allows unauthorized actions through the `_decreaseAuthQuota` function, indicating a pathway that may bypass the intended access control. Check and mark that nonce has not been c.reason: The validation of the 'nonce' relies on the assumption that it will not be reused before the state updates are completed. However, in a network with potential latency and pending transactions, an attacker might exploit timing-based scenarios to reuse a nonce, thus bypassing the validation check. This issue highlights a vulnerability in the logic that needs to be addressed to enhance security.

Validate that recipientAddress's balance.poc: The validation checks for 'signatory != address(0)' after recovering the signatory from the signature. If a forged signature is crafted that resolves to an address which is non-zero but not authorized, it can potentially pass this check and call '_decreaseAuthQuota' before performing the transfer.
Validate that recipientAddress's balance.reason: The validation for the signatory checks if it is non-zero and matches the provided signature, but a forged signature could still pass these checks as long as it resolves to a valid non-zero address. This allows unauthorized actions through the `_decreaseAuthQuota` function, indicating a pathway that may bypass the intended access control. The reliance on signature integrity without additional checks on the authorization context introduces potential vulnerabilities.

Validate that recipientAddress's balance.poc: Since 'volume' is a parameter in the function call and not strictly validated before usage, a user could continuously call 'receive' in a loop while using a maliciously crafted 'signatory' that allows them to abuse 'volume' without exhausting their authorization quota because 'authQuotaOf' could return erroneous quota due to the bucket overloading in '_decreaseAuthQuota'.
Validate that recipientAddress's balance.reason: The validation of 'volume' occurs within the '_decreaseAuthQuota' function, which is called from the 'receive' function. However, due to potential manipulation of the authorization quota via the 'authQuotaOf' function, which can return an inadequate quota when conditions are not met correctly, there is a window available for an attacker to bypass the intended restriction on 'volume'. This allows for exploitation through repeated transactions. While there are checks in place, the significant dependency on external configurations (autoQuotaRatio and autoQuotaPeriod) increases risk and uncertainty in the validation flow.

state_variables.RECEIVE_TYPEHASH: bytes32 public constant RECEIVE_TYPEHASH = keccak256("Receive(uint256 fromChainId, address to, uint256 nonce, uint256 volume, address signatory)");
state_variables.received: mapping (uint => mapping (address => mapping (uint => uint))) public received;

external_functions: modifier updateAutoQuota(address signatory) virtual{ uint quota = authQuotaOf(signatory); if(_authQuotas[signatory] != quota){ _authQuotas[signatory] = quota; lasttimeUpdateQuotaOf[signatory] = now;} _;}

function authQuotaOf(address signatory) virtual public view returns (uint quota){ quota = _authQuotas[signatory]; uint ratio = autoQuotaRatio != 0 ? autoQuotaRatio : Factory(factory).getConfig(_autoQuotaRatio_); uint period = autoQuotaPeriod != 0 ? autoQuotaPeriod : Factory(factory).getConfig(_autoQuotaPeriod_); if(ratio == 0 || period == 0 || period == uint(-1)) return quota; uint quotaCap = cap().mul(ratio).div(1e18); uint delta = quotaCap.mul(now.sub(lasttimeUpdateQuotaOf[signatory])).div(period); return Math.max(quota, Math.min(quotaCap, quota.add(delta)));}

result.vuln: MappingBase.receive:function receive(uint256 fromChainId, address to, uint256 nonce, uint256 volume, Signature[] memory signatures)
result.reason: The implementation does not adequately handle signature replay attacks, especially across multiple chains. An attacker could potentially reuse a valid signature on a different blockchain, which could lead to unauthorized funds being released.

Using 'msg.value' without proper checks can lead to situations where unexpected amounts are accepted, especially in cross-chain scenarios where values can vary due to routing. This could allow for abuse or flooding the contract with small fee payments.

findings.constraint: Check that sourceChainID is in the predefined list of supported chain IDs
findings.reason: No validation checks for sourceChainID against a predefined list in the provided code.

findings.constraint: Verify that the toChainID specified in the transaction matches the current chains ID
findings.reason: The provided code does not contain checks to verify whether toChainID matches the current chains ID.

findings.constraint: Validate that recipientAddress's balance change before and after equals amount
findings.poc: If the _receive function does not correctly handle the volume transfer, it could lead to incorrect balances.
findings.reason: The check appears to be dependent on the implementation of the _receive function, which is not provided; thus, potential bypass is possible.

findings.constraint: Validate that the bridge's balance change before and after equals amount
findings.reason: There are no checks implemented in the code to verify the balance change of the bridge.

findings.constraint: Check and mark that nonce has not been consumed to prevent replay
findings.reason: A check is implemented to ensure nonce has not been consumed, thus preventing replay attacks.

findings.constraint: Cryptographic proof that the transaction truly occurred and was finalized on the source chain (e.g., multi-signature, MPC signature, zero-knowledge proof, or Merkle proof)
findings.poc: If the implementation of the Factory does not correctly validate sufficient signatures, it can be circumvented.
findings.reason: Validation of signatures relies on an external contract (Factory), and if that contract is compromised or incorrect, the proof validation could fail.

findings.constraint: Check whether the externalCallAddress is authorized to use.
findings.reason: No checks are present in the code to ensure that the externalCallAddress is authorized.

findings.constraint: Validate that externalCallFunction is in the allowed function signature list
findings.reason: No validation is found in the code for the externalCallFunction against a list of allowed function signatures.
